intro: Calendula malvaecarpa, commonly known as the common marigold, is a flowering plant native to Europe, North Africa, and western Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its bright yellow to orange petals and dark brown central cones. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has hairy, lobed leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields. Calendula malvaecarpa is known for its medicinal properties and is used in traditional herbal remedies.
